meanings.sent1: In grammar, we learn about pluralities when studying nouns.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of pluralities using examples.
meanings.sent3: The party had to decide how to handle the pluralities of opinions among its members.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork beautifully captured the colorful pluralities of nature.
meanings.sent5: The diversity of cultures showcased the rich pluralities of the city.

meanings.definition: A large number or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: There were pluralities of books stacked on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: The market offered a wide variety of products in pluralities.
meanings.sent3: The pluralities of stars in the night sky were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent4: The garden bloomed with pluralities of flowers in different colors.
meanings.sent5: The festival attracted pluralities of visitors from all over the world.

meanings.definition: The largest number of votes in an election, but less than a majority.
meanings.sent1: The candidate won by pluralities in a close election.
meanings.sent2: Pluralities can sometimes lead to a runoff in elections.
meanings.sent3: The pluralities in the election results caused a stir among the voters.
meanings.sent4: She secured the seat with the support of pluralities in the district.
meanings.sent5: The political debate focused on strategies to gain pluralities in key regions.
